cost_breakdown.reasons: A safe and comfortable car-following trajectory. It correctly maintains the lane and follows the lead vehicle at a reasonable, though slightly close, distance. Progress is appropriately limited by the lead vehicle.
Unsafe overtaking maneuver. Trajectory crosses into the oncoming lane, creating a high risk of a head-on collision with vehicle #3. The maneuver is infeasible and dangerous.

Indecisive and uncomfortable maneuver. The trajectory exhibits unnecessary lateral movement towards the centerline, reducing comfort without any safety or efficiency benefit over simple car-following.
Dangerous and erratic maneuver. Involves a sharp, uncomfortable swerve into the oncoming lane with minimal forward progress, creating an extreme collision risk and exhibiting poor vehicle control.
